edu.rit.numeric

Class RootBisection

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.numeric.Root
      • edu.rit.numeric.RootBisection

  • public class RootBisection
extends Root
    Class RootBisection provides an object that finds roots of a Function using bisection. Given a real-valued function of a real-valued variable f(x), an instance of a subclass of class Root finds a value x such that f(x) = 0, as follows: The function is evaluated at the midpoint of the bracketing interval; the midpoint replaces the interval endpoint whose function value has the same sign; this is repeated until the difference between the interval endpoints is less than the given tolerance; the interval midpoint is returned as the root.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RootBisection(Function func)
      Construct a new object to find roots of the given function.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected double findRoot(Function func, Bracket brack, double tol)
      Find a root of func.f() in the bracketing interval brack.x1 to brack.x2 with tolerance tol.

    • Method Detail

      • findRoot

        protected double findRoot(Function func,
              Bracket brack,
              double tol)
        Find a root of func.f() in the bracketing interval brack.x1 to brack.x2 with tolerance tol. Function values at the bracketing interval endpoints are brack.f_x1 and brack.f_x2.
        Specified by:
        findRoot in class Root
        Parameters:
        func - Function.
        brack - Bracketing interval object.
        tol - Tolerance.
        Returns:
        Root of func.f(x).
